list.title: Question 1
list.content:
The subscription fee for an online project management software by
AB-Tech is $$40$ per month. If the customer buys for a whole year in
advance, a discount of $$130$ is applied.
This can be modelled by the following function, $P(n)$, which gives the
total cost when paying annually for the subscription.
$$$P(n)=40n−130,n≥12$$$
where $n$ is the number months.


Find the total cost of buying a subscription for $2$ years.
[2]



Find $P−1(1790)$. [2]



The subscription price for a different online project management tool by
YZ-tech is $$35$ per month, however customers can only purchase
annually in advance, and there are no discounts. The total subscription
cost of YZ-tech's software is less than AB-tech's software when $n>k$ .

Find the minimum value of $k$. [3]
list.markScheme:
Substituting $n=24$ into the $P(n)$ function, we get
$$$P(n)P(24)​=40n−130=40(24)−130=$830​​$$$


Let's denote $P(n)$ by $y$. To find the inverse we can interchange
the variables $n$ and $y$ and rearrange for $y$, as follows
$$$yn40yyP−1(n)​=40n−130=40y−130=n+130=40n+130​=40n+130​​$$$
We can now find
$P−1(1790)$ as follows
$$$P−1(1790)​=401790+130​P−1(1790)=48 months​​$$$


For AB-tech's software we we were given the pricing function
$$$P(n)=40n−130$$$
For YZ-tech, we can define the function, $S(n)$, to
represent the subscription price for their software
$$$S(n)=35n$$$


![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/2b908e8c-786e-4fec-844c-19b9653ea308/images/7386b1f2-6825-49b7-88df-da2a1e5501e7/7402d7e1fc9d51e4e9f6b0f5ea74f75143d1438e.svg)


From the graph, $S(n)<P(n)$ for $n>26$.
The price of YZ-tech's software is less than AB-tech's when $n>26$.
Therefore,  $k=26​$

list.title: Question 2
list.content:
The circumference, $C$, of a given circle can be represented by the
function
$$$C(A)​=2ππA​​,A≥0,​$$$
where $A$ is the area of the circle.
The graph of the function $C$, for $0≤A≤24$, is shown below.


![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/0b7df521-ef1b-4c8a-87b1-32e564791325/images/ce866e5f-cd7d-44ed-9b43-19469f4d4737/3388e210bb4d6f02426816cb2651396f2822c4c1.svg)




Find the value of $C(24)$. [1]



On the grid above, draw the graph of the inverse function, $C−1$.
[3]



In the context of the question, explain the meaning of
$C−1(2π)=π$. [1]
list.markScheme:
Evaluating $C(A)$ for $A=24$, we get
$$$C(A)​=2ππ24​​≈17.4​​$$$


If we draw the graph of the inverse function, $C−1$, on the grid
below, we have


![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/0b7df521-ef1b-4c8a-87b1-32e564791325/images/3b17f6c6-ed96-4a9a-b40e-195870b66409/fae26733051cc1a7c15c3478abb0d0697e69d7fa.svg)




$For a given circle, when the circumference is 2π, the area is π​$

list.title: Question 3
list.content:
The radius of a cylindrical container with height
$x$ cm is
$$$r(x)=x56​,4≤x≤16​$$$

Find the range of $r$.[3]


The function $r−1$ is the inverse function of
$r$.




Find $r−1(8)$.


Interpret the answer to part (b) (i) in
context.


Find the range of $r−1$.[4]
list.markScheme:
A sketch of $r(x)$ shows that the minimum value is found where $x=16$ and the maximum value is found where $x=4$.


![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/47ec87ad-d03d-40ae-b070-86ca7d589f8a/images/5e3319c6-2a5b-4f5e-9751-0736b3e580f0/AI1002a.PNG)


Evaluating $r$ at the endpoints of its domain, we get
$$$r(4)r(16)​=456​=14=1656​=3.5​$$$
Therefore the range of $r$ is $3.5≤r≤14​$




Let $r−1(8)=a$. This implies that $r(a)=8$.
$$$a56​aa​=8=856​=7​$$$
$r(7)=8$ and therefore $r−1(8)=7​$


When the radius of the container is $8$cm the height is $7$cm


Using the definition of a function inverse, we have
$$$range of r−1​=domain of r​$$$
Therefore the range of $r−1$ is $4≤r−1≤16​$

list.title: Question 4
list.content:
The perimeter, $P$, of a given rectangle can be represented by the
function
$$$P(A)​=62A​​,A≥0,​$$$
where $A$ is the area of the rectangle.
The graph of the function $P$, for $0≤A≤24$, is shown below.


![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/ab39cb62-6642-463f-8d55-b3b4e61d9fc1/images/d77d8ca4-60bf-47df-b71e-f5b1a82ac6ef/13be64c3a363091e834dcc3848fda5575c4c9b07.svg)




Find the value of $P(24)$. [1]



On the grid above, draw the graph of the inverse function, $P−1$.
[3]



In the context of the question, explain the meaning of
$P−1(12)=8$. [1]
list.markScheme:
Evaluating $P(A)$ for $A=24$, we get
$$$P(A)​=6224​​≈20.8​​$$$


If we draw the graph of the inverse function, $P−1$, on the grid
below, we have


![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/ab39cb62-6642-463f-8d55-b3b4e61d9fc1/images/ff3fed55-9366-4196-a9da-e2951114048a/0d0a8ad4bbd75e6a6d48466c8f25e5a869af08fe.svg)




$For a given rectangle, when the perimeter is 12, the area is 8​$

list.title: Question 5
list.content:
The area, $A$, of a given square can be represented by the function
$$$A(P)​=16P2​,P≥0,​$$$
where
$P$ is the perimeter of the square.
The graph of the function $A$, for $0≤P≤20$, is shown below.


![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/d67d010e-f96a-4959-94d7-dd830ba69f41/images/db5dae3b-4d37-46d8-a488-586d1cdc2312/8c2c1a298c1b79e92e64f94fe2b4a4d452e488ad.svg)




Find the value of $A(20)$. [1]



On the grid above, draw the graph of the inverse function, $A−1$.
[3]



In the context of the question, explain the meaning of
$A−1(4)=8$. [1]
list.markScheme:
Evaluating $A(P)$ for $P=20$, we get
$$$A(P)​=16202​=25​​$$$


If we draw the graph of the inverse function, $A−1$, on the grid
below, we have


![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/d67d010e-f96a-4959-94d7-dd830ba69f41/images/8288a0de-f259-43ef-a694-da2f13679dc3/508588bd8662a40575516587374d1e3379be6249.svg)




$For a given square, when the area is 4, the perimeter is 8​$

list.title: Question 6
list.content:
A function is defined by $g(x)=3−x+312​$ for $−9≤x≤9$,
$x=−3$


Find the range of $g$. [3]



Find the value of $g−1(0)$. [2]
list.markScheme:
The graph of $g(x)=3−x+312​$ is plotted below.


![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/616164a4-faa5-4676-9f3c-4769c3d41be8/images/23cbcbe8-15fc-47be-83cd-0d50dcfbc06b/AI881a.PNG)


From the graph, the range of $g$ is $(−∞,2]∪[5,∞)]​$


$g−1(0)$ corresponds to the value of $x$ when $g(x)=0$.


![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/616164a4-faa5-4676-9f3c-4769c3d41be8/images/47112aa7-51a3-49b0-9ae0-889a5f78ea51/AI881b.PNG)


From the graph, $g(x)=0$ when $x=1$. Hence,
$$$g−1(0)=1​​$$$

list.title: Question 7
list.content:
A function is defined by $f(x)=x2−4x+1​​$, for the
domain $−1≤x≤5$, $x=2$


Find the range of $f$. [4]



Find the value of $f−1(52​)$. [2]
list.markScheme:
The graph of $f(x)=x2−4x+1​​$ is plotted below


![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/771c20b0-6647-4ac7-8e39-ad9d8d9a73fc/images/a00f5f74-aa09-49c4-9f67-0d0f12c451c2/AI883a.PNG)


From the graph, the range of $f$ is
$$$​(−∞,0]∪[0.117,∞)])​​$$$


$f−1(52​)$ corresponds to the value of $x$ when $f(x)=52​$.


![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/771c20b0-6647-4ac7-8e39-ad9d8d9a73fc/images/45b4d1cb-3fb1-439c-ad5f-8bba89649cdf/AI883b.PNG)


From the graph, $f(x)=52​$ when $x=3$. Hence,
$$$​f−1(52​)=3​​$$$

list.title: Question 8
list.content:
A function is defined by $f(x)=x+5​$, $x≥−5$


Determine the domain and range of $f$. [3]



Find the value of $f−1(6​)$. [2]
list.markScheme:
The graph of $f(x)=x+5​$ is plotted below.


![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/8ae200fc-c8c2-45b4-aa13-f0e9f279cb9a/images/881074fb-10d0-4145-9bf1-ee5c090fa571/1805e337e073512237286acb5583906bdf31bb84.svg)


From the graph, the domain of $f$ is
$$$[−5,∞)​$$$
and the range of $f$ is
$$$[0,∞)​$$$


$f−1(6​)$ corresponds to the value of $x$ when
$f(x)=6​$.


![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/8ae200fc-c8c2-45b4-aa13-f0e9f279cb9a/images/5e47c30a-f23c-47d5-b947-709f7668078d/7c19742e74bbe79b3eeb3b8509335ac2df5057a0.svg)


From the graph, $f(x)=6​$ when $x=1$. Hence,
$$$f−1(6​)=1​$$$
